title: MODULES-10550 fix keyspec parsing to allow whitespaces in options and…
last_comment:
I fixed some of the warnings generated by rubocop in e276389, but the remaining ones may be a bit more tricky: rubocop is complaining about commas without a trailing whitespace, but these are inside the keyspec string presenting an ssh authorized_keys line and whitespaces after a comma is forbidden by ssh.

Also the authorized_key examples lines are rather long (>200 characters). Trying to break them  into several lines might make the code difficult to understand. There might be a rubocop linter problem complaining about putting a regex into %r{}, as this should be done only when trying to match a "/" - which is not the case here as the slashes just enclose the regex.

Would be happy for some advice here.

title: Workaround for hangs of the docker_client in the facts genereation
last_comment:
Hi
  Since Facter::Util::Resolution is extended by Core::Execution (https://www.rubydoc.info/gems/facter/Facter/Util/Resolution)  i was sure that this should work the same.

My facter have to be to old for execute **timeout** option to work:
```
# cat  /var/lib/puppet/lib/facter/sleep.rb 
require 'facter'
Facter.add(:sleep) do
  setcode do
    begin
      Facter::Core::Execution.execute('sleep 10', options = {:timeout => 5})
      'did not timeout!'
    rescue Facter::Core::Execution::ExecutionFailure
      'timeout!'
    end
  end
end
```

```
# date; facter -p sleep; date
Mon Dec 23 14:49:23 UTC 2019
did not timeout!
Mon Dec 23 14:49:33 UTC 2019
```

```
# facter  -v
2.4.6
# facter  -p os 
{"name"=>"Ubuntu", "family"=>"Debian", "release"=>{"major"=>"16.04", "full"=>"16.04"}, "lsb"=>{"distcodename"=>"xenial", "distid"=>"Ubuntu", "distdescription"=>"Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS", "distrelease"=>"16.04", "majdistrelease"=>"16.04"}}
```

I barely know ruby but looking at the gem source: https://www.rubydoc.info/gems/facter/Facter/Core/Execution/Base
i can not see how this **timeout** option should work since the command is executeded by statement
```
out = %x{#{expanded_command}}.chomp
```

title: MODULES-10522: Add support for the --condition parameter
last_comment:
Hi @mattock 

Thanks for submitting this PR. 
The issue you are having there seems to be caused by the warning you have received. The main problem is the parsing of the iptables output above this [line](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-firewall/blob/2a569afd70b82933b971864fcc1e174888ef3d81/lib/puppet/provider/firewall/iptables.rb#L546)

Please let us know if you are having trouble fixing this problem.

title: [WIP] Add random_fully support
last_comment:
Rules from calico that were breaking this module:

```
-A cali-PREROUTING -m comment --comment "cali:V6ooGP15glg7wm91" -m mark --mark 0x40000/0x40000 -m rpfilter --invert -j DROP
```

title: Make haproxy.cfg comment a proper sentence
last_comment:
Hello @kasimon ,

Thank you for this contribution. in order to get it merged, please fix the tests. 

Lines [104](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/classes/haproxy_spec.rb#L104), [271](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/classes/haproxy_spec.rb#L271), and [337](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/classes/haproxy_spec.rb#L337) in spec/classes/haproxy_spec.rb also need to be updated, as do lines [115](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L115), [188](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L188), [327](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L327), [400](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L400), [481](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L481), and [548](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-haproxy/blob/master/spec/defines/instance_spec.rb#L548) in spec/defines/instance_spec.rb.

Cheers!

last_comment:
Hi @koshatul 

Thank you for submitting this PR.

I've added a commit to fix the unit testing for this change, however it appears there are some acceptance testing failures caused by this change that you can verify in travis. 

Can you verify and fix the testing for those failures ? You might be able to run the tests on your local machine with Litmus to have an easier time getting these issues solved. Please let us know if you are having trouble with this.

title: Fix multiple xtrabackup regressions (+JIRA ticket)
last_comment:
@carabasdaniel Thanks for the hints. All tests are working now. Ready for merge :)

(Fixes in https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/pull/1245/commits/3e0e11af5f60870811d69f8500dd16b68bcb575f: On Debian and older versions of Ubuntu the xtrabackup package name was wrong. Debian also requires the gnupg2 package. On Scientific Linux 6 the value of $releasever in YUM differs from RedHat/CentOS, making the Percona repo incompatible (an upstream issue, nothing that should be handled in this module); as a workaround $releasever is set to the same value that works on RedHat/CentOS.)

Hello any news on this PR ? This is a blocker for guys using Debian as package start mysql on post install scripts.
Typically starting mysql without binlog dir will prevent mysql from starting then package installation is marked as failed.

title: Puppet 4 functions
last_comment: I've started some work to finalise this in https://github.com/DavidS/puppetlabs-stdlib/tree/modules-1882-move-function-api and https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/IAC-114

title: (WIP) Add volatile_fact() function
last_comment:
So, there are issues with getting the facts if not set in scope as `$facts`, a) risk of getting server side facts when called on master and b) if there are many "deferred facts" they would all result in running Facter and this would be slow c) since each call will run Facter, the values may differ for the same fact
 
The best would be if the facts were already present in scope when deferred calls are resolved. That requires a change to Puppet however as the setup and use of PAL on the agent side for resolution of Deferred must be given the facts to use. (The rest should already be supported by PAL; i.e. setting `$facts` etc.)

If not computed and set up front, then I think the result needs to be cached and kept while resolving deferred values. This would be good since if there is no call to get a deferred fact then Facter does not need to run at all. If going this route, there is a supported caching mechanism that functions can use. With this there is still the problem of getting the wrong facts (for server when agent was intended) as the place intention is known is when setting up the context (i.e. when setting up PAL for resolution, or when setting up for apply, master compile, bolt apply compile, etc.).

title: (wip) use json, not pson, steal Bens work to make pup4
last_comment:
fwiw, these are failing on lint checks not tests

> Wanted to know if there were any concerns with the approach though.

I've heard at least someone express a preference for making this replace the existing method rather than deprecating the old and replacing it with a "stdlib::" namespaced one. I'm unclear if we should then remove the stricter type checking? Do others have thoughts on the approach?

title: pdksync - (maint) travis updates: bundler and slack
Don't set --branch equal to revision when depth > 0
last_comment:
Hi @evanstachowiak,

Thanks for opening this PR.

In order to check out a specific revision I recommend you avoid using the depth parameter and just use a reset to your desired revision after cloning the branch you need. Here's an example manifest that does a reset on a commit SHA:

```
vcsrepo { '/test/repo':
  ensure   => present,
  provider => git,
  source   => 'git://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-vcsrepo.git',
  revision => 'efea838d92b283fff697a58ebdd723a02e7a0e84',
}
```
